Erinnerung - memory

SUMMARY:  INNER | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL:  FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

de.a46.memory
Class Loader

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--de.a46.memory.Loader
All Implemented Interfaces:
RessourceContainer
public class Loader
extends java.lang.Object
implements RessourceContainer

Class Loader is responsible for connecting to outer resources. It takes necessary paths from a ParameterProvider, which is in this memory implemented by class Starter. Also a MultimediaProvider is needed to get Images and AudioClips from, that is implemented by class Starter, too.

Loader should be a unique instance, that is passed to each component, which needs ressources. To control the current state of loading you can add a LoadListener, that receives LoadEvents.

All media is grouped. There are
- welcomeImages: to be shown during loading the others,
- basicImages: all stuff needed for layout,
- currentCardImages: 18 image-pairs mixed in an array of 36, corresponding to cards,
- currentCardAudios: 18 audioclip-pairs, mixed in an array of 36, corresponding to cards,
- currentBackgroundImages: an array of two backgroundImages,
- helpText: a twoDimensional String-array containing a help-text.
references to all data are stored internal into a hashtable.

Each group has its own methods. Call them in following order (eg basicImages):
- init() initializes all data except currentGameData. Call this only once.
- loadBasicImages() creates the images, that will start loading automatically.
- waitForBasicImages() waits for the images. LoadEvents are casted.
- getTrialsImage(), getHiddencardImages() etc. to get the images.
unfortunately AudioClips cannot controlled to been loaded.

There are two helpers, to get paths to all resources.
Class Multimedias reads from a file, that containes an unlimited number of lines representing cards, both images and AudioClips.
Class MProperties reads from a file, that contains keys with point to welcomeImages, basicImages and backgroundImages. This file has java-properties format.
Also there is a textfile containing the helptext, which is accessed by class TextGetter.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Till Zoppke

Field Detail

LOADING_NOTHING

public static final int LOADING_NOTHING
encoding current state of loading. Default state - no waitFor() is active.

LOADING_WELCOME

public static final int LOADING_WELCOME
encoding current state of loading. Currently welcomeImages are loading.

LOADING_BASIC

public static final int LOADING_BASIC
encoding current state of loading. Currently waiting for basic images.

LOADING_CURRENT

public static final int LOADING_CURRENT
encoding current state of loading. Waiting for currentCardImages.

LOADING_CURRENT_BACKGROUND

public static final int LOADING_CURRENT_BACKGROUND
encoding current state of loading. Waiting for backgroundImages.

init

initCurrentGameData

public void initCurrentGameData()
initializes the current game data (background, images, audios). Cards are mixed by random. After this call, data can be loaded.

public java.awt.Image[] getCurrentBackgroundImages()
returns an array of two background images from the BACKGROUND_IMAGES array. These images are valid for one game of memory.
Specified by:

setRoundCounter

public void setRoundCounter(int rounds)
sets the roundCounter, that is counting the number of memory games played. This method is needed when newgame is clicked to avoid the automatic increment.
Parameters:
rounds - the new number for the roundcounter

getRoundCounter

public int getRoundCounter()
returns the number of memory games played.
Returns:
the actual value of the roundCounter.
